snippet: The release of the U.S. soldier has created political problems for both parties amid allegations that he had left his base without permission.
abstract: Release of Sgt Bowe Bergdahl from captivity in Afghanistan has created political problems for both parties amid allegations that he had left his Army base without permission; two comrades in his platoon see case of desertion; Obama administration is having to defend his exchange for five Taliban detainees, and Republicans face delicate politics for attacking America's last known prisoner of war.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT, HELENE COOPER and CHARLIE SAVAGE
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt and Charlie Savage reported from Washington, and Helene Cooper from Brussels. Andrew W. Lehren contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The release of the U.S. soldier has created political problems for both parties amid allegations that he had left his base without permission.

headline.main: Bowe Bergdahl’s Vanishing Before Capture Angered His Unit
headline.print_headline: G.I.’s Vanishing Before Capture Angered His Unit

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
